CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The blend films showed almost equivalently measured smooth surfaces ( according to their root-mean-square ( rms ) roughness ) with small degrees of phase separation.

Let's think step by step.

1. "blend films" - This could be considered a material, as it refers to a specific type of film made from a blend of different substances.
2. "small degrees of phase separation" - This phrase refers to a process that occurs in materials, rather than being a material itself. Therefore, it is not a material name entity.

So, in the given paragraph, "Material Name" entities are "blend films".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
1. "blend films" - This is the only clear material name entity in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The blend films showed almost equivalently measured smooth surfaces ( according to their root-mean-square ( rms ) roughness ) with small degrees of phase separation.

Let's think step by step.

1. "root-mean-square (rms) roughness"

This is the only clear "Property Name" entity in the paragraph. It refers to a specific type of measurement of the roughness of a surface. Root-mean-square (RMS) roughness is a measure of the roughness of a surface that is calculated by taking the square root of the mean of the squares of the deviations of the surface height from the mean plane. It is a common and important property used in the study of surfaces, especially in fields such as materials science and engineering.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. "root-mean-square (rms) roughness"

This is the only clear Material Property entity in the paragraph. The other phrases, "blend films" and "small degrees of phase separation," are more likely to be referring to specific objects or processes rather than properties. Root-mean-square (RMS) roughness is a measure of the roughness of a surface, which is a material property. It is calculated by taking the square root of the mean of the squares of the deviations of the surface height from the mean plane. It is a common and important property used in the study of surfaces, especially in fields such as materials science and engineering.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
